definition: Berkeley (name)/George Berkeley (1685-1753), Bishop of Cloyne, famous British philosopher/Berkeley, university city in the San Francisco bay area, California
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
name of weed plant (fat hen, goosefoot, pigweed etc)/Chenopodium album

sentences.english: Berkeley took a leaf out of Newton's book by going instrumentalist.
sentences.chinese: 柏克莱借鉴了牛顿的工具主义。

sentences.english: And the empiricists are Locke, Berkeley and Hume.
sentences.chinese: 经验主义者有洛克，柏克莱和休谟。

sentences.english: Stanford and Berkley will experience a huge shift towards righteousness in their student bodies.
sentences.chinese: 在史丹佛和柏克莱的学生中将经历公义的大翻转。

sentences.english: Kaspar Mossman is a Ph. D. candidate in biophysics at the University of California, Berkeley.
sentences.chinese: 美国加州大学柏克莱分校生物物理学博士候选人。

sentences.english: JOHN KUBIATOWICZ is associated with the University of California, Berkeley.
sentences.chinese: 库比亚托维兹与美国加州大学柏克莱分校有渊源。

sentences.english: Don't miss these Golden Bears hidden in the Berkeley campus.
sentences.chinese: 漫步柏克莱校园中，你会和这些金熊们擦身而过。

pinyin: Pu3 lin2 si1 dun4 Da4 xue2

definition: University of California/abbr. for 加利福尼亞大學|加利福尼亚大学[Jia1 li4 fu2 ni2 ya4 Da4 xue2]
Stanford (University)/also written 斯坦福[Si1 tan3 fu2]
California Institute of Technology (Caltech)/abbr. for 加利福尼亞理工學院|加利福尼亚理工学院
pinyin: Jia1 zhou1 Li3 gong1 Xue2 yuan4
Ge1 lun2 bi3 ya4 Da4 xue2
